name: Castillo Inn at the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were only in Santa Barbara 1 night and the Castillo Inn was perfect. The price was reasonable for SB and te room was great. It reminded me of old stye Southern California. The room was very spacious and immaculate. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom clean and up to date. There were a lot of special touches that made the room feel welcoming and homey....like the super plush towels and the decor. The faux painting gave the room a serene feel. It is a motel, though, so be aware that you park steps from your door, but despite this, the hotel was quiet and we had no difficulties sleeping. The location was close to te beach, wharf and Brophy Brothers - a fanastic seafood restaurant. It s a longer walk to the happening part of State St., but not undoable if you don't mind walking.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my fall-back option for accomodation in Santa Barbara. When I knew that our other choices weren't going to work out, I called Cabrillo Inn. The woman who picked up was very friendly and helpful. I only needed a room with one bed, but they were all booked up. So she said I could have a room with 2 beds at the price of 1 bed. So I booked it.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early, and they let us check in, but when we went to the room they were still cleaning it, so we went out to explore instead. When we got back later I tried turning on the tv (which was advertised as having free HBO). The tv would turn on, and we could hear the channel, but there was no image- just all black. I figured maybe after a few minutes the image would come on, nope. Called the front desk, a girl came to look at it, and tried fiddling around with it but nothing worked. She said she would get her father (who is the owner). As soon as her father walked in the image appeared. OK. That's great. Only took about 20-30 minutes though! (And I didn't see the HBO channels anywhere)
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We slept well here, it was a comfortable room, and beautiful bathroom!
reviews.title: Excellent comfort and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, in the morning I tried turning on the tv again, and the same situation! ARGH! We left to go find breakfast- they have a free breakfast. Well, breakfast was some small muffins (banana was good), icky looking fruit, store-bought danishes and juice. Not very filling at all.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is hard to find a bargain on a decent hotel room in Santa Barbara, but Castillo Inn is an affordable and good (though not fancy) small hotel located only a block from the beach. To be sure, it is an old motel, but one that has been renovated to a fairly high standard. Once inside the room, nothing really looks like an old motel. Furniture is all relatively new and bathrooms are up to date. It’s a 10 minute walk to State Street, where you’ll find most of the restaurants and night life. The continental breakfast was minimal but sufficient for us – there are restaurants close by if you need more. Our only small complaint was that the desk clerk, while pleasant and polite, was not particularly helpful with tips and local knowledge. All in all, we’d go back and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Rare Affordable Room in Santa Barbara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is actually a motel. Our room was spacious, very clean, with a huge king-size bed, and sofa. The bathroom was spacious. It's within walking distance to restaurants, the ocean, State Street, etc. The only downside is the continental breakfast, which consists of danish, muffins, bananas and juice and coffee. Plan to go to a restaurant for breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel/motel, and have.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel. Would recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Santa Barbara has an interesting mix of small inn's and hotel chains. We selected Castillo Inn for the price and location. Not walking distance to State Street, but the location is near the water and pier which is much quieter. Rooms are clean and of good size. Bathrooms must have been remodeled as they were very nice. Room decor is a bit dated, but nothing that does not fit the SB atmosphere. Small continental breakfast is fine for a quick bite. Watch the check in time. The front desk closes at 11 pm so you better arrive before that hour! We almost did not make it as we were driving from LA. We called ahead and received an "oh well" attitude. It all worked out and we arrived in time with a back up plan to obtain the room keys just in case. I am fine with the arrival policy, but be a little bit more flexible rather than make us sweat out the two hour drive from LA.
reviews.title: Quiet place to stay in SB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Castillo Inn is just a block from the waterfront, and old-fashioned, one-story, park-in-front-of-your room motel. It's attractive and well-maintained. It's staffed by one manager who does everything, and he;s very pleasant, friendly, and helpful. My room was quite small--two queen beds, a dresser, TV, desk, and barely enough room to walk between them, which was fine for my needs--but I wouldn't want to be there with a family. (They may have bigger rooms).The room was ore stylishly decorated than the typical moderate-price motel--this is Santa Barbara, after all, and you won't feel like you're in Anyplace, USA. I was a little concerned that the free breakfast is basically,juice, coffee, fruit, and some breakfast pastries--not what I'd usually eat--but I have to say those enormous scones were terrific. There's no breakfast room--you have to bring it back to your room. There are good restaurants (and a breakfast restaurant) within walking distance, and it's a short walk to Stearns Wharf. I liked it just fine, and would choose it again.
reviews.title: Nice place, great location, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: close to the beach, reasonable prices, quiet, newly remodeled it looked like inside.
reviews.title: great place, near the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great find in Santa Barbara. Great location just back from the beach - and in between the marina and State St/Stearns Wharf. Very clean and tidy - and the bed was very comfortable. The room was well appointed - particularly for the price! Would definitely recommend/return.
reviews.title: Good value, great stay. Would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: For those driving, this is a motel-style place with (free) car parks right outside the rooms. And it's easy to find and get too - an added bonus for out of towners!
reviews.title: Great value at the Marina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Santa Barbara. I had a very pleasant stay at the Castillo Inn on May 21st. Dan, the Manger, is very knowledgeable and accommodating. I stayed here based on the TripAdvisor ratings.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dan suggested Brophy Bros for dinner right across on the Marina. It was very good and reasonably priced, and I got to watch the sun go down over the Marina.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money, Clean and Spacious Room
Great location, friendly staff
reviews.text: Lunch at Mac's Fish & Chip Shop on State St was also a great suggestion. Mac was an Investment Banker and opened up 2 years ago. The fish is moist and the batter really complements.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful room and location....clean, large bathroom and parking spot right outside the door. Very easy walking distance to restaurants and waterfront.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Great value compared to many other places to stay. The best nights sleep since getting to Anerica. Friendly and helpful reception. Nicely decorated rooms. Soft towels. Large rooms with two large double beds. Breakfast included, what more could you ask for. Book well in advance as they are always fully booked!
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks Castillo Inn, for four wonderful night's sleep and very comfortable accommodations. Clean room, big bathroom, free Wifi, and we didn't have to haul our luggage more than a few feet to our room. Breakfast included a vast assortment of juices, good coffee (not the usual hotel swill), scones and muffins from a local bakery, fresh fruit. The proprietor was super nice and went out of his way to make our stay pleasant. Since we brought our own cereal and milk, but no bowl, he lent us one of his own. That's the kind of service you get when the owner lives above the shop! Location was so nice --across the street from the beautiful marina, a short walk to State Street and Stearn's Wharf, and a five minute walk to a walking/bike path that hugs the shoreline and takes you a couple of miles along cliffs overlooking the ocean. This is why the Castillo in is ranked #3, folks. If you want the disco life, stay somewhere else. If you want a great value in a lovely location, stay here.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice motel for a good price. rooms were charming & pretty,everything seemed fresh & new. good location if you want to be close to the beach & water & bike trail as well as a few restaurants and wharf.
reviews.title: was happy with our choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: very comfy bed.
reviews.title: Waaaay over-rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had such a lovely day in Santa Barbara. The man at the front desk was very nice and informative, the room was spacious with an outdoor patio, and the bathroom had a jaccuzzi bathtub which we put to good use. We found 2 half smoked cigars out on the patio, which we were surprised to see since its a no-smoking room, we didn't know if the people before us left them, or someone threw them over the wall from outside.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: We had breakfast at Sambo's; a short walk from the hotel, yummy food and nice view of the beach.
reviews.title: Great small, limited-service inn, within 1/2 a block of beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little place to stay in Santa Barbara, as long as you're not looking for a full-service hotel. This is a small inn with limited facilities, meaning there is no on-site restaurant, no pool, and no other facilities to speak of, except for the rooms and a very small lobby. That being said, my wife and I weren't looking for a full-service hotel, so this was perfect. Most of the inn's rooms are on the ground floor, and you park your car right outside your room door, as in a motel. Don't let his turn you off if you're not inclined to be a "motel person", because the rooms are spacious, updated and modern, and truly well-appointed in a Tuscan-style theme. We stayed in room 27, and there were two queen beds on one side of the room, with a substantial alcove hosting an armoir, a small refrigerator, and a good-sized desk and office chair on the other. The bathroom is beautifully tiled, again evoking that Tuscan theme. To top it off, there is a substantial enclosed patio, complete with a full-size table for four, wih four chairs, a table umbrella, and a chaise lounge. This is not the rickety stuff you find at most hotels, including more expensive hotels, rather this is solid equipment, quite a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Santa Barbara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: So, the place gives a good impression, but what about cleanliness? The room and lobby are very clean, and one definitely gets the feeling that the manager/owner takes cleanliness seriously.
reviews.title: Cozy and sweet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price includes a very limited continental breakfast that you pick up from the lobby and take back to your room. That might not be a thrilling prospect in a typical motel room, but here you can go out on the patio and enjoy your small meal. The breakfast consists of canned or bottled juices/fruit nectar, coffee or tea, and what appear to be locally-made scones, pre-packaged cinnamon buns, and take-away fruit, such as apples, oranges, and bananas.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stop for a night or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night while doing a road trip to Southern California. The rooms are very clean and spacious. There were 3 adults and 1 child and it was the perfect place for us. We could park our car right in front of the room (at no extra charge) to access items we needed without having to lug everything to the room. The price was very reasonable. But it is not within walking distance to State Street. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect quick stop in SB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: We stayed one night here during a drive down the coast. The inn was in a great location 1 block from the marina and a short walk to town. Our room was beautiful - we upgraded to the best room for just 20 dollars more and it was worth it. We had a jacuzzi and a patio. Room was clean and comfortable and very spacious. The service was okay but not terrible. Just not as friendly or helpful - very by the rules. But would highly recommend this inn. Very good value for money.
reviews.title: Beautiful inn near the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Clean, comfortable, well located and nice. Pleasant staff.
reviews.title: Perfect simplicity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: We loved this hotel for many reasons. Great location near the beach. Excellent host. Clean room. Very spacious and convenient. Very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location near beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night when passing through Santa Barbara en route to LA. Wish it was a week.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVELY. Stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a quick weekend trip to Santa Barbara. Based upon Travelocity reviews, I made reservations at Castillo Inn. When I called to check availability, the gentleman that answered at the hotel actually adivsed me that I could get the AAA rate on-line for $10.00 cheaper, so I booked it. Glad I did because when I arrived on Sat. they were full.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: What was once an older motel, has completely remodeled rooms. Very nice and clean and updated. Free wifi, free parking in front of your room. Seemed like a litte on the pricey side at first until you start checking prices at the other hotels- and this one is only 1 block from the water.
reviews.title: More than a motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess this is a family owned motel and the girl at the front desk-Page- was very helpful in assisting in locating things for us around town. They also have a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning. Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Large comfy rooms, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was only here for one night: the place was spotless, I loved the bathroom, mine had a jacuzzi function in the bath. The breakfast consisted of a few packeted self-service muffins and fruit/ coffee etc, which you collect from reception and consume in your room. Actually this was fine. The owner took to explain the highlights and nightlife of the town, which was very helpful.
reviews.title: All good and staff went the extra mile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a few days to celebrate Valentine's Day and I cannot say enough good things. It's the best value I've found so far in Santa Barbara. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The updates are lovely and each night was incredibly quiet. We stayed in a king room with jacuzzi tub and it was perfect. The location couldn't be better. We were there for 3 days and 3 nights and never used our car. We walked to State Street, the warf which is right across the street, and to the beach. Dan was incredibly professional and helpful. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Lovely Inn and very professional and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stopped for 1 night in Santa Barbara on our way up the coast. This hotel was exactly what we needed, nothing more: clean, affordable, and within walking distance of local attractions (beach, restaurants on the pier, downtown/State Street). I'd recommend it for anyone with the same needs.
reviews.title: Good for our 1-night stay
I'd book again
reviews.text: Nice clean spacious. My husband said the people next door were noisy until 3am but a good pair of ear plugs apparently drowned them out for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as we drove the California Coast Highway. It is close to the beach, which is great, but we also found it fine to walk to State Street - it took about 20 - 25 mins. There are also a couple of good bars within much shorter walking distance of the motel.
reviews.title: Good, but not exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable, and plenty spacious. The staff were helpful and friendly, and were keen that we had a comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: It was quite expensive given that the rooms are fairly basic in design and facilities, but on the whole a good option given that Santa Barbera is an expensive place to stay.
reviews.title: Cute, clean and friendly

aka: Castillo Inn At The Beach Hotel
